misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No notional-machine misconception evident (correct arithmetic + correct I/O model)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes they must (1) read three numeric inputs, (2) compute gallons used as distance / milesPerGallon, then (3) multiply by pricePerGallon to get total cost, and (4) print it.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no clear gap between the student’s mental model and Java’s execution model here. Variables are assigned after inputs are read, the arithmetic uses doubles (so Java performs floating-point division), and the final result is stored and printed explicitly.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; program should run and produce the expected style of output (minor formatting differences possible, e.g., number of decimals).
